meaningMnemonic: If you've got an <kanji>eye</kanji> on a certain <kanji>course</kanji>, it's a <vocabulary>subject</vocabulary> you really want to take. Maybe you're in school and that means you'll be taking a lot of <vocabulary>course</vocabulary>s. Maybe you're a teacher and you're planning out your <vocabulary>curriculum</vocabulary>. Either way, you have your eye on the course-prize.
readingMnemonic: The readings are the on'yomi readings, but you learned the kun'yomi reading for 目 before. So, you have to remember that this word uses もく instead of め. To do that, imagine seeing that the <vocabulary>subjects</vocabulary> you're allowed to take next term are different than everyone else's. The other kids notice, and start <reading>mock</reading>ing (もく) you for it. Think of what those subjects are and how you're being mocked for having to take them.
